column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Handle
#Text=Differences of Opinion
#Text=An opinion is not fact , but what someone thinks or believes .
#Text=Not everyone will have the same opinions on things , and some opinions are very hard to change .
#Text=Since people think different , try these steps to reduce differences and see what happens .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Try to think like the other person .
#Text=Sometimes , it seems hard to look at something from another perspective , but it 's a good way to understand why they feel as they do .
#Text=You see , if you really try to understand both sides , you can approach the issue more neutrally .
#Text=Religion and love can be very debatable , but that 's not the point .
#Text=You can understand someone if you really want to get along with them .
#Text=This is not about RIGHT versus WRONG .
#Text=Consider the following examples :
#Text=If you 're with same sex marriage , try to understand why someone else might not approve of those of the same gender marrying .
#Text=It does go against some religious rules held by some people .
#Text=If you are opposed to same sex marriage , try to put yourself in a position where you love someone very much , but you ca n't get married because other people have an issue with it .
#Text=Suppose your child wants to go on a vacation with a friend , but there could problems and implications without his/her guardian with them on the trip .

#Text=As the parent , try to understand why your child wants to go and have fun , and why being denied permission seems unfair simply because you 're working the weekend and he/she will be left with nothing to do .
#Text=Your mom has refused to let you go on a trip with your friend .
#Text=Try to put yourself in her shoes and you 'll realize your mother is going to worry about you ; there 's no way to stop her from it .
#Text=To her , your safety is more important than how much fun you could have with your friend .
#Text=Give it time and see if the argument will fade away .
#Text=You and your friend have a fight about something , and there is no possible way you will agree on it - ever .
#Text=Step away and give yourself time to think about it .
#Text=If you really care about someone , you can set every difference aside and still be their friend .
#Text=You can always try to make them understand ( in a calm way ) that you understand why he/she wo n't change their mind and why you wo n't either .
#Text=Explain that you should just let it go and set it aside because , in all honesty , your friendship is about much more than your differences .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=If talking to the person about the differences , do n't be rude .
#Text=Come to your friend calmly and rationally , because nobody likes someone with a rude attitude .
